nl.strohalm.cyclos.services.transactions
Interface PaymentServiceLocal

All Superinterfaces:
PaymentService, Service
All Known Implementing Classes:
PaymentServiceImpl
public interface PaymentServiceLocal
extends PaymentService

Local interface. It must be used only from other services.

Method Summary

Method Detail

validateMaxAmountToday

void validateMaxAmountToday(Account account,
                            TransferType transferType,
                            java.math.BigDecimal maxAmount,
                            java.math.BigDecimal amount)
Validates the max amount per day but using the max amount specified as a parameter instead of the transfer type's max amount.
NOTE: It is exposed in the local interface to be invoked by customs Payment CF validations.

Throws:
MaxAmountPerDayExceededException

bulkChargeback

java.util.List<BulkChargebackResult> bulkChargeback(java.util.List<Transfer> transfers)
Chargebacks all the given transfer atomically, returning, in the same order, a list with results. As web services can pre-process transfers, the list may contain null entries. In this case, the corresponding result will also be null.

canMakePayment

boolean canMakePayment(AccountOwner from,
                       AccountOwner to,
                       TransferType transferType)
To perform a payment, the logged user must either manage the from owner or to owner and must be allowed to use the specified transfer type (if any)

conciliate

Transfer conciliate(Transfer transfer,
                    ExternalTransfer externalTransfer)
Conciliates the given transfer with the given external transfer

confirmPayment

Transfer confirmPayment(java.lang.String ticket)
                        throws NotEnoughCreditsException,
                               MaxAmountPerDayExceededException,
                               EntityNotFoundException,
                               UpperCreditLimitReachedException
Confirms a payment which is pending for the given ticket

Returns:
The main transfer. It may contain children transfers (generated, for example, by fees)
Throws:
NotEnoughCreditsException - The account does not have enough credits
MaxAmountPerDayExceededException - The account has exceeded the maximum transaction amount per day for the specified transfer type
EntityNotFoundException - Invalid ticket
UpperCreditLimitReachedException - The payment cannot be performed because it would make the receiving account go beyond the upper credit limit
InvalidPaymentReceiverException - When the given DoPaymentDTO is not the system

doBulkPayment

java.util.List<BulkPaymentResult> doBulkPayment(java.util.List<DoPaymentDTO> dtos)
Performs all the given payments atomically, returning, in the same order, a list with results

insertWithNotification

Payment insertWithNotification(TransferDTO dto)
                               throws NotEnoughCreditsException,
                                      MaxAmountPerDayExceededException,
                                      UnexpectedEntityException,
                                      UpperCreditLimitReachedException
Inserts a payment, notifying users. Intended to be called by automatically generated transfers, like loan repayments or fee charges.

Throws:
NotEnoughCreditsException - The account does not have enough credits
MaxAmountPerDayExceededException - The account has exceeded the maximum transaction amount per day for the specified transfer type
UnexpectedEntityException - Either transfer type or payment receiver are invalid
UpperCreditLimitReachedException - The payment cannot be performed because it would make the receiving account go beyond the upper credit limit
InvalidPaymentReceiverException - When the given DoPaymentDTO is not a member

insertWithoutNotification

Payment insertWithoutNotification(TransferDTO dto)
                                  throws NotEnoughCreditsException,
                                         MaxAmountPerDayExceededException,
                                         UnexpectedEntityException,
                                         UpperCreditLimitReachedException
Inserts a payment, without notifying users. Intended to be called by automatically generated transfers, like loan repayments or fee charges.

Throws:
NotEnoughCreditsException - The account does not have enough credits
MaxAmountPerDayExceededException - The account has exceeded the maximum transaction amount per day for the specified transfer type
UnexpectedEntityException - Either transfer type or payment receiver are invalid
UpperCreditLimitReachedException - The payment cannot be performed because it would make the receiving account go beyond the upper credit limit
InvalidPaymentReceiverException - When the given DoPaymentDTO is not a member

loadTransferForReverse

Transfer loadTransferForReverse(java.lang.String traceNumber,
                                Relationship... fetch)
                                throws EntityNotFoundException
Loads a transfer by the trace number for the current ServiceClient
If the transfer was not found insert a reverse for the transfer.

Returns:
the unique transfer or exception
Throws:
EntityNotFoundException - if the transfer was not found

notifyTransferProcessed

void notifyTransferProcessed(Transfer transfer)
Notifies registered listeners that a transfer has been processed

processScheduled

void processScheduled(Period period,
                      boolean notify)
Process all scheduled payments a scheduled payment component, optionally notifying members

processScheduled

Transfer processScheduled(Transfer transfer)
Pay a scheduled payment installment setting the specified date as the transfer's process date

purgeOldTraceNumbers

void purgeOldTraceNumbers(java.util.Calendar time)
It removes the trace numbers before (or at) one day before the specified date.
